text:
Paul and Timothy, servants of Jesus Christ,
To all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers and deacons:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank my God for every reminder of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In every prayer of mine for you all, I have always made requests with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: due to your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am confident of this very thing, that He who began a good work in you will perfect it until the day of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is right for me to think this of you all because I have you in my heart, since both in my imprisonments and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, you all are fellow partakers of my grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my witness, how I long after you all with the affection of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all discernment,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you may approve things that are excellent so that you may be pure and blameless for the day of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: being filled with the fruit of righteousness, which comes through Jesus Christ, for the glory and praise of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I want you to know, brothers, that the things which happened to me have resulted in advancing the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that my imprisonments in Christ have become known throughout the entire palace guard and to all the rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a great many of the brothers in the Lord, having become confident because of my incarcerations, have dared to speak the word without fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some indeed are preaching Christ out of envy and strife, and some also from good will.
speaker: Narrator

text: The former preach Christ out of contention, not sincerely, intending to add trouble to my circumstance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the latter preach out of love, knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What then? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is preached. And in this I rejoice.
Indeed, I will rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that through your prayer and the support of the Spirit of Jesus Christ, this will result in my deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Accordingly, it is my earnest expectation and my hope that I shall be ashamed in nothing, but that with all boldness as always, so now also, Christ will be magnified in my body, whether it be by life or by death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to me, to continue living is Christ, and to die is gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I am to live on in the flesh, this will mean fruitful labor to me. Yet I do not know what I shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am in a difficult position between the two, having a desire to depart and to be with Christ, which is far better.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, to remain in the flesh is more needful for your sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having this confidence, I know that I shall remain and continue with you all for your joyful advancement of the faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that your rejoicing for me may be more abundant in Jesus Christ when I am in your presence again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only let your conduct be worthy of the gospel of Christ, that whether or not I come and see you, I may hear of your activities, that you are standing fast in one spirit, with one mind, striving together for the faith of the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be frightened by your adversaries. This is a sign to them of their destruction, but of your salvation, and this from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to you it was granted on behalf of Christ not only to believe in Him, but also to suffer for His sake,
speaker: Narrator

text: having the same conflict which you saw in me and now hear is in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is any encouragement in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any compassion and mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text: then fulfill my joy and be like-minded, having the same love, being in unity with one mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let nothing be done out of strife or conceit, but in humility let each esteem the other better than himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let each of you look not only to your own interests, but also to the interests of others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let this mind be in you all, which was also in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who, being in the form of God,
    did not consider equality with God something to be grasped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But He emptied Himself,
    taking upon Himself the form of a servant,
    and was made in the likeness of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And being found in the form of a man,
    He humbled Himself
    and became obedient to death,
        even death on a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore God highly exalted Him
    and gave Him the name which is above every name,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow,
    of those in heaven and on earth and under the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord,
    to the glory of God the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, my beloved, as you have always obeyed, not only in my presence, but so much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is the One working in you, both to will and to do His good pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do all things without murmuring and disputing,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you may be blameless and harmless, sons of God, without fault, in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, in which you shine as lights in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hold forth the word of life that I may rejoice on the day of Christ that I have not run in vain or labored in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, and even if I am offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I take delight and rejoice with you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason you also take delight and rejoice with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy shortly to you, that I also may be of good comfort when I get word concerning you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have no one like-minded, who will sincerely care for your welfare.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all seek their own, not the things of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you know of his proven worth, that as a son with a father, he has served with me in the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I hope to send him soon after my situation is resolved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I trust in the Lord that I, myself, shall also come shortly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I thought it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, who is my brother and companion in labor, fellow soldier, your messenger, and he who ministered to my necessity.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he longed after you all and was filled with heaviness, because you heard that he was sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed he was sick, near death. But God had mercy on him, and not only on him, but also on me, lest I should have had sorrow upon sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I sent him the more eagerly, that when you see him again, you may rejoice and I may be less sorrowful.
speaker: Narrator

text: So receive him in the Lord with all joy. And hold such ones in high regard,
speaker: Narrator

text: because for the work of Christ he was near death, not regarding his life, endeavoring to make up for your lack of service toward me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, my brothers, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you is no trouble to me, and it is reassuring for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch out for dogs, watch out for evil workers, watch out for those who practice mutilation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are the circumcision who worship God in the Spirit, and boast in Christ Jesus, and place no trust in the flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text:
though I also have confidence in the flesh.
If any other man thinks that he has reason to trust in the flesh, I have more:
speaker: Narrator

text: I was circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, and a Hebrew of Hebrews; as concerning the law, a Pharisee;
speaker: Narrator

text: concerning zeal, persecuting the church; and concerning the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: But what things were gain to me, I have counted these things to be loss for the sake of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, certainly, I count everything as loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have forfeited the loss of all things and count them as rubbish that I may gain Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: and be found in Him, not having my own righteousness which is from the law, but that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which is of God on the basis of faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: to know Him, and the power of His resurrection, and the fellowship of His sufferings, being conformed to His death,
speaker: Narrator

text: if somehow I might make it to the resurrection of the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I have already attained or have already been perfected, but I follow after it so that I may lay hold of that for which I was seized by Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, I do not count myself to have attained, but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind and reaching forward to those things which are ahead,
speaker: Narrator

text: I press toward the goal to the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore let those of us who are mature be thus minded. And if you think differently in any way, God will reveal even this to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, according to what we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us be of the same mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, become fellow imitators with me and observe those who walk according to our example.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many are walking in such a way that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ. I have told you of them often and tell you again, even weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their destination is destruction, their god is their appetite, their glory is in their shame, their minds are set on earthly things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But our citizenship is in heaven, from where also we await for our Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: who will transform our body of humiliation, so that it may be conformed to His glorious body, according to the working of His power even to subdue all things to Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, my beloved and longed-for brothers, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: I exhort Euodia and Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I ask you also, true companion, help those women who labored with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and with my other fellow laborers, whose names are in the Book of Life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord always. Again I will say, rejoice!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let everyone come to know your gentleness. The Lord is at hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be anxious for nothing, but in everything, by prayer and supplication with gratitude, make your requests known to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will protect your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brothers, whatever things are true, whatever things are honest, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report, if there is any virtue, and if there is any praise, think on these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do those things which you have both learned and received, and heard and seen in me, and the God of peace will be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I rejoiced in the Lord greatly that now at last you have revived your concern for me. Regarding this, you did care, but you lacked opportunity.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not speak because I have need, for I have learned in whatever state I am to be content.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know both how to face humble circumstances and how to have abundance. Everywhere and in all things I have learned the secret, both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can do all things because of Christ who strengthens me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless you did well having shared in my affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now you Philippians know also, that in the beginning of the gospel when I departed from Macedonia, no church shared with me in the matter of giving and receiving, except you alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even in Thessalonica, you sent aid once and again for my necessity,
speaker: Narrator

text: not because I desired a gift, but I desire fruit that accumulates to your account.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have everything and abound. I have been filled, having received from Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you, like a sweet fragrance, an acceptable sacrifice, well pleasing to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my God shall supply your every need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to God and our Father be glory forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the saints greet you, especially those who are of Caesarâ€™s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
